documents.document: A Croatian TV station airs a show about teapots that lasts for 2,700 years.
An English boy is obsessed with collecting bearskin rugs.
A prime minister switches bodies with a woolly mammoth.
A queen kisses a chameleon inside a chocolate island.
A polar bear materializes next to Queen Victoria. A dentist says: "This is the end."
A garden sinks into a river filled with tequila.
There is a 17th century Alaskan prophecy that you will be imprisoned by a warlock.
A hairdresser celebrates Thanksgiving with a rhinoceros and a camel.
There is a typhoon in New Orleans. It rains violinists.
A blonde sultan plays a game of chess with an Airbnb rental.
You are imprisoned in a glass paperweight for the crime of stealing unrequited love.
An anxious president passes a law that everyone must be clean.
A courtesan slowly turns into a volcano. She becomes world-famous.
There is a willow tree in Vancouver that is infinitely beautiful.
A Korean carpenter plants a seed. A city grows from it.
A Macedonian witch gives birth to a silver termite mound.
An accountant catches a bus to Finland. In that time, she lives another life as a Maltese clown.
A lonely bookshop owner plants a seed which grows into a cherry tree made of tax law.
A deeply depressed sociologist has a rare gift: He can understand the language of bumble bees.
A professor dreams of an art gallery that can destroy the Sun, and becomes obsessed with finding it.
Tonight, an old woman will appear and give you the answer.
During a lunar eclipse an inscription appears in the sky above Mecca. It reads: "Beware of the colour grey."
A vulture lays an egg. Inside the egg is a countess.
A time travelling governess from ancient Sparta materializes in front of you. She says: "I am here to give you a circus tent."
An eagle made of fireflies is born in Munich.
A Sicilian cook bakes a cake made of ice.
A placenta is chosen to be the next CEO of Procter & Gamble.
An army major puts a hex on a parish priest. It causes him to gradually turn into a comet's tail.
In heaven there is a dandelion with the power to create immigration.
An essay whispers to a solicitor: "I wish I was a salamander."
The fate of a billionaire depends on one particular cathedral.
A clown whispers to Nero: "I love Sydney."
An anaesthetist bicycles across a dinner plate.
If you pay a werewolf in Florida the sum of 8,800 dollars, it will destroy time and space.
An anthropologist buys a map which shows the location of every cemetery in the Bay Area.
A penniless king decides to kill thirst.
Twelve angels are going on a quest. Their aim is to rescue a veterinarian who has been trapped in a thermometer by a goblin.
A guilt-stricken poet keeps an unusual possession in a locked box: A clockwork lobster.
A melancholy innkeeper is dancing all night with balloons.
A sorcerer is drinking cocktails in the belly of a leopard.
A congresswoman decrees that there will be a new sign of the zodiac: The skull.
A professor buys a crystal ball which lets him see every disappointment since the birth of Christ.
A baron sees a crocodile with bongs instead of teeth.
Philosophy is in love with romance.
The body of a homeless person is found in a staircase. Next to it is a peppermint and a broken cello. Can you explain what happened?
A woman discovers a letter by Derrida on the subject of ice cream vans.
In Toronto there is a birthday cake which is listening to a violin concerto.
A dentist steals endometriosis and hides it inside a castle.
An embittered Polish necromancer owns a pair of spectacles that let him see, hear, smell, touch and taste libertarianism.
A medieval manuscript describes a world filled with the number zero.
There is a monster in Sri Lanka that is 40 times wiser than you.
A pianist invents a better version of inertia: Vomiting.
You wake up and realize you have turned into Donald Trump.
Every Instagram celebrity in Iceland is worried.
In Melbourne is a lake in which every drop of water is a mansion.
A Caribbean watchmaker sees a stain on a carpet in the shape of a broken heart.
A depressed clown writes a manuscript that is made out of Janet Jackson CDs.
A university student spends his life writing an almanac about mushrooms.
A baby is born in Germany with Picasso's Guernica painted on its chest.
There is a 5th century BC Albanian prophecy that you will be kidnapped by a labyrinth.
An owl appears next to Kim Kardashian. It says: "Don't do it."
Every nurse in Milwaukee is whispering.
A Portuguese empress listens to a phonograph that plays the music of dancing.
You are transported to a city which looks like Newcastle, but everything is pink. Ahead of you is a road paved with alarm clocks.
At midnight Toronto sinks into a lake.
A Danish duke decrees that everyone must be bald.
A bisexual schoolmaster is turning into sexism.
A stone-hearted realtor falls in love with the number Pi.
A trumpet floats past you. Nearby, a prime minister is singing the Star-Spangled Banner.
A flight attendant has trapped an ancient Spartan scribe inside a glacier.
An invisible pyramid covers the whole of Baltimore.
In San Diego there is a heart which is singing.
A watchmaker builds an enormous cathedral and fills it with cigarettes.
A satrap discovers a tiny glass sphere which lets him see every kite in Cape Town.
A geisha catches a taxi to a crystal ball.
A football stadium is haunted by the ghost of a Venetian hermit. She carries a panther in her hands.
A countess receives a strange gift at her baby shower: A porcelain diamond.
An archaeologist turns into a motel. Nobody notices.
An Assyrian book collector spends her whole life writing a mathematical treatise about trampolines.
A beauty therapist invents a better version of the French Revolution: Doing nothing at all.
A video game designer and a soldier play a game in which the aim is to become a doll's house.
Every day, a bank manager in Baltimore turns into a waiting room during her lunch break.
A midwife searches for a judge with eyes made of chocolate on a glass thundercloud.
A scholar is praying in an Egyptian mummy.
A movie producer is concentrating on a ray of light in Florence.
A river allows you to understand the language of giant squids.
A Swiss field marshal becomes obsessed with having sexual intercourse with prime numbers.
A Marxist discovers that darkness does not exist, and is driven insane.
A violinist dreams about every rainbow that has taken place in Washington DC.
A nun owns a pair of spectacles that let her talk to single-payer healthcare.
A politician sees a painting of a rose petal that can destroy ambiguity, and devotes her life to finding it.
A witch is sitting in a tower. She is thinking about candy bars. A sea serpent is having sexual intercourse behind her.
A four-leaf clover is in a psychiatric hospital in Cambodia.
A Belgian naturopath runs a clinic that treats anthills.
A Texan cocktail waitress walks into a forest and discovers a cypress tree made of Breakfast at Tiffany's.
A brilliant architect designs a pyramid made of climate change. But due to a shortage of climate change, it is never finished.
A maharajah sleeps in a glass cornfield.
A group of dentists are setting out on an adventure. Their aim is to find a mysterious button with the power to destroy star.
A scorpion asks you to solve a riddle: What is Republican, has eight armpits, and is found in a souvenir shop?
A president owns a painting which depicts every act of love by a priest.
